question: Show how my data is distributed over a geographical area

children.question: Show evolution of an attribute over different areas
Point out outliers or highlight some areas

comparison.1: Better than elevation maps to emphasize variations and quantify them on a scale
comparison.2: Better than dot-density maps to show variations on a continuous area

comparison.1: Better than isartyhmic maps and elevation maps to show precise occurrences
comparison.2: Better than  elevation maps to quantify data

comparison.1: Better than isarythmic maps and elevation maps to highlight important differences between the highest and lowest values.

children.question: Keep a general overview of variations over a geographical area
Display data on a geographical map
Show data on a geographically accurate map
Represent the variations of a physical quantity over space.
Represent other types of variations over space.

comparison.1: Better than stepped relief maps and chloropleth maps to show a phenomenon that is not specific to geographical areas.
Better than dasymetric maps to compare data in different areas.
comparison.2: Better than chloropleth maps to deliver a strong message.

comparison.1: Better than dasymetric maps to compare data in different areas.
comparison.2: Better than stepped relief map to represent clearly a lot of data.

children.question: Simplify the representation with a schematic view

comparison.1: Better than cartogram map and treemap to keep geographic distribution in mind.
Better than proportional symbol maps and treemaps to highlight a striking difference between the size of a geographical area and the quantity it withholds.
Better than proportional symbol map and cartogram map to compare values between different areas on a scale.

children.question: Just highlight numbers and proportions
Use an abstract view that emphasizes values

comparison.1: Better than stacked bar graphs, double-sided bar graphs and mosaic graphs to emphasize only on the quantity within a category.
Better than bar graphs, stacked bar graphs and mosaic graphs to show the deviation to a quantified objective.
Better than bar graphs and double-sided bar graphs to show how a group is broken down into categories and their proportions.
comparison.2: Better than mosaic graphs to rank and emphasize each element according to only one characteristic (length or height).

comparison.1: Better than bar graphs, stacked bar graphs and double-sided bar graphs to rank and emphasize each element according to two characteristics.

children.question: Use a schematic geographic view
Represent a path, a route or a network
Show a path or a route

comparison.1: better than route maps to show details associated to a particular journey
comparison.2: better than space-time cube maps to show a trajectory on a flat surface

comparison.1: better than route maps to show details associated to a particular journey
comparison.2: better than space-time cube maps to show a trajectory on a flat surface

comparison.1: better than route map and strip map to show step by step evolution over time

children.question: Represent a network
Represent fluxes between different areas

comparison.1: Easier to read than alluvial graphs for complex interactions.
comparison.2: Better than flow maps to show a complex network of fluxes as areas can be rearranged (no geographic reality).

comparison.1: Better than circos and alluvial graphs to keep geographic specificities in mind.
Better than circos and alluvial graphs to keep geographic specificities in mind.

children.question: Represent a relationship between geography and time
Show evolution

comparison.1: Better than alluvial graph to show step by step evolution over time.
Better than space-time cube map to show a before/after transition.

children.question: Display travel time
Show how my data evolves over time
Highlight one-time events over time
Makes comparisons

comparison.1: Better than stacked bar graphs to compare the different values of a given element over time.
Better than histograms to compare the evolutions of several categories at different points in time.

children.question: Simply display the events on a timeline

comparison.1: Better than timeline (events) to display quantities.
Better than histograms to describe or explain different points in time.

children.question: Study a global temporal evolution
Simply show distributions over time
Show a thematic change over time

comparison.1: Better than stream graphs to emphasize on single events and give detail.
Better than timelines (global) to show the relative importance/dominance of events. They are displayed in chronological order, but the timeline is not as explicit as in timelines (global).

children.question: Display a quantitative change over time

comparison.1: Better than circular graph to display precise numeric quantities and exploit numerical data.
Better than line graphs to show a repetitive phenomenon or display a variation over a circular period (day, month, seasons, …). It is also better to compare the values over the said period.

children.question: Compare the evolutions of different categories over time

comparison.1: Better than stacked bar graphs to show clearly a variation within a category between two points in time.
comparison.2: Better than superposed line graphs to compare values only at chosen points in time : offers a clearer view !

comparison.1: Better than bar graphs (several) to show proportions within each category.
Better than stacked bar graphs and bar graphs (several) to display the continuous evolution of different quantities over time.

children.question: Show how geographical flows evolved over time

comparison.1: Easier to read than alluvial graphs for complex interactions.
comparison.2: Better than flow maps and space-time cube maps to show a complex network of fluxes as areas can be rearranged (no geographic reality).

comparison.1: Better than circos and flow maps for adding a temporal dimension easily
comparison.2: Better than space-time cube maps to show a network of flows on a large scale

comparison.1: Better than circos and alluvial graphs to keep geographic specificities in mind.
comparison.2: Better than space-time cube map to show a network of flows on a large scale.

comparison.1: Better than circos and alluvial graphs to show a network of flows on a large scale.
comparison.2: Better than flow maps to study the spatial and temporal evolution of a phenomenon.

children.question: Show what is the nature and organisation of elements composing my data
Show the nature and proportions of elements within my data
Show nature and not necessarily proportions
Show text data

comparison.1: Better than lists at emphasizing some elements.
Better than tag clouds at showing elements in an ordered manner.

children.question: Show numeric data
Show both nature and proportions
Group my data into a very small number of categories

comparison.1: Better than pies & rings and enclosure trees to show relative importance of a very small number of topics.
Better than basic shapes and enclosure trees to show similar or striking proportions.
Better than basic shsapes and pies and rings to show inclusion.

children.question: Show the exhaustivity of my data or create many categories
Read (numeric) quantities easily

comparison.1: Better than treemaps to display numbers.
Better than mosaic graphs to represent huge quantities of data and show a colour-coded characteristic.

children.question: Show proportion without numeric indicators

comparison.1: Better than enclosure trees to show a bunch of unhierarchised topics.
Better than tag clouds to show hierarchy.

children.question: Show interactions and structure within my data
Characterise relationships or show flows
Emphasize flows

comparison.1: Easier to read than alluvial graphs and sankey graphs for complex interactions.
Better than circos for adding a temporal dimension easily.
comparison.2: Simplified sankey graph - better than sankey graphs for simple interactions.

comparison.1: Better than alluvial graphs for complex interactions
comparison.2: Better than circos because a temporal dimension can be added easily

children.question: Map relationships
Emphasize relationships
Highlight the strengh of a relationship

comparison.1: Better than circos and arc graphs when all elements are interacting with each other and each interaction can be quantified.
Better than circos for showing interactions between elements that can be linearly organised.
comparison.2: Better than adjacency matrix to single out interactions.

comparison.1: Easier to read than arc graphs for complex interactions.
comparison.2: Better than adjacency matrix to single out interactions.

children.question: Show existing relationships
There are many subcategories within my data

comparison.1: Better than circos for showing interactions between elements that can be linearly organised (e.g. chapters in a book, historical events,…).
Better than adjacency matrix to single out interactions.

children.question: There are few subcategories within my data

comparison.1: Better than tree views to classify elements in a few categories.
comparison.2: Can compare more dimensions than an alluvial graph.

comparison.1: Better than tree views and hive graphs to show evolution.
comparison.2: Better than tree views to structure elements into categories.

comparison.1: Better than alluvial graphs and hive graphs when there are few interactions and many independant elements.

children.question: Represent a network
Include (technical) specificities about different clusters and entities
Do not include technical specifications

comparison.1:: Better than radial trees to show a network without emphasizing on a certain topic.
comparison.2: Simplified network - unhierarchised network structure.
comparison.3: Better than subway maps to display complex interactions.

comparison.1: Better than node-link graphs, network structures and radial graphs to show evolutions.
comparison.2: Better than node-link graphs and network structures when there are not too many interactions between elements.

comparison.1: Better than node-link graphs to show hierarchy within a network.
comparison.2: Better than radial trees to show a network without emphasizing on a certain topic.
comparison.3: Better than subway maps to display complex interactions.

comparison.1: Better than node-link graphs, network structures and subway maps to show organisation of a network around a certain topic.

children.question: Show organisation and structure
Show a network or a hierarchy
Represent a network
Include (technical) specificities about different clusters and entities
Do not include technical specificities

comparison.1: Better than radial trees to show a network without emphasizing on a certain topic.
comparison.2: Simplified network - unhierarchised network structure.

comparison.1: Better than node-link graphs to show hierarchy within a network.
comparison.2: Better than radial trees to show a network without emphasizing on a certain topic.

children.1: Better than node-link graphs, network structures and subway maps to show organisation of a network around a certain topic.

children.question: Show a clear hierarchy
Show a clear hierarchy

comparison.1: Better than dendograms, link trees and enclosure trees for representing many elements and few hierarchical levels.
comparison.2: Better than network structures to show an organisation where lower elements are not interdependant.

comparison.1: Better than link trees and enclosure trees for representing elements and few hierarchical levels.
comparison.2: Better than network structures to show an organisation where lower elements are not interdependant.

comparison.1: Better than tree view and dendogram to show a very large number of hierarchy levels in a limited space.
comparison.2: Better than network structures and enclosure trees to represent a hierarchy simply.

comparison.1: Better than tree views, dendograms, link trees and enclosure trees to show interdependance between elements in addition to showing hierarchy.
Better than tree views, dendograms, link trees and network structures to show inclusion.

children.question: Show a clear hierarchy
Break down data into topics and categories
Show categories and their composition
Show volume correponding to each category

comparison.1: Better than treemaps to represent a small quantity of data.
comparison.2: Better than mosaic graph to show inclusion.

comparison.1: Better than mosaic graphs to represent huge quantities of data and show a colour-coded characteristic.
comparison.2: Better than enclosure trees to represent data in an organised way and show more data.

comparison.1: Better than treemaps and enclosure trees to display numbers.
comparison.2: Better than enclosure trees to represent data in an organised way.

children.question: Show composition of each category

comparison.1: Better than mosaic graphs to emphasize important categories and fade out the less important ones.
Better than crossmaps to read quantity and proportions.

children.question: Show topics and their proximity

comparison.1: Better than isoline maps to emphasize on links between topics.
Better than circos to show groupings by topics.

children.question: Show evolutions in the composition of my data
Explain changes happening in given intervalls

comparison.1: Simplified sankey graph - better than sankey graphs for simple interactions.
comparison.2: Better than history flows to show detailed changes between two versions of a document.

comparison.1: Better than alluvial graphs and sankey graphs to keep track of thematic variations within a text between several versions.
Better than alluvial graphs for simplified interactions.
comparison.2: Better than history flows to show detailed changes between two versions of a document.

children.question: Show a continuous evolution
Show quantities and proportions within my data
Mainly show how my data is distributed
Point out groupings or outliers

comparison.1: Better than dot graphs, stripe graphs and stem-and-leaf graphs to show correlation.
Better than scatter plots to highlight groupings and outliers.
comparison.2: Easier to colour-code than stripe graphs.
comparison.3: Better than stem-and-leaf graphs to show repartition rather than display precise values.

comparison.1: Better than scatter plots to highlight groupings and outliers.
comparison.2: Better than dot graph to quantify precisely each element.
comparison.3: Better than stem-and-leaf graphs to show repartition rather than display precise values.

comparison.1: Better than scatter plots, dot graphs and stripe graphs to order and look up numeric values.

children.question: Show evolution over time

comparison.1: Better than line graphs to compare data over time intervals.
comparison.2: Better than bar-and-line graphs to study the variation of only one quantity at a time.

comparison.1: Better than histograms and line graphs to show a variation over a long period of time in a synthetic way.
Better than spark lines to display quantities.
comparison.2: Better than histograms to show a continuous evolution.

children.question: See statistical indicators

comparison.1: Better than box-and-whisker symbol graphs to show a margin of error on several measures.
Better than error bar graph to show indicators such as median, quartile and standard deviation.

children.question: Make comparisons within my data
Make comparisons over time

comparison.1: Better than bar-and-line graphs, histograms and superposed line graphs to compare values to a quantified objective.
Better than superposed line graphs to show variation over time intervals.
comparison.2: Better than histograms to study the variation of only one quantity at a time.
comparison.3: Better than double-sided bar graphs to compare absolute values over time.

comparison.1: Better than line graphs, double-sided bar graphs and bar-and-line graphs to compare data over time intervals.
Better than histograms, bar-and-line graphs or double-sided bar graphs to display the continuous evolution of different quantities over time.

children.question: Make comparisons between categories
Compare data according to numbers and proportions
Emphasize key values and make quick numeric comparisons possible

comparison.1: Better than stacked bars to show clearly a variation between categories.
comparison.2: Better than double-sided bar graphs to show absolute variations between categories.

comparison.1: Better than bar graphs and double-sided bar graphs to show how a group is broken down into categories and their proportions.
comparison.2: Better than superposed line graphs to compare values only at chosen point in time.

comparison.1: Better than bar graphs and stacked bar graphs to show the deviation to a quantified objective.
comparison.2: Better than superposed line graphs to compare values at the same point in time.

comparison.1: Better than stacked bar graphs,  bar graphs and double-sided bar graphs  to display the continuous evolution of different quantities over time.

children.question: Compare data according to numbers and proportions

comparison.1: Better than basic shapes to show similar or striking proportions.
Better than pies & rings to show relative importance of a very small number of topics .

children.question: Sort and compare data according to criteria

comparison.1: Better than parallel coordinate graphs to compare data according to a small number of criteria.
Better than radar graphs to compare data according to a great number of categories.
